tool.name: Get-contig-names
tool.description: Extract contig / scaffold / chromosome / gene names from representative rice genomes
tool.command:
#if str($ref.source) == "history": mkdir index_dir && ln -s $ref.index index_dir/genome.fa && grep ">" index_dir/genome.fa | cut -f1 -d' '|sed 's/>//' > $output && rm -rf index_dir #else: grep ">" '$ref.index.fields.path' | cut -f1 -d' '|sed 's/>//' > $output2
#end if

param.name: source
param.label: Select a reference genome/gene from your history or use a built-in genome database?
param.help: Built-in rice genomes for indica, temperate and tropical japonicas, and aus
param.option: Use a multiFASTA from the history

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset
No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Get-contig-names - what it does**
This tool extracts the names of all contigs/scaffolds/chromosomes/genes in the multi-FASTA published rice genomes (Nipponbare 1.0 japonica reference, MSU RGAP7 Nipponbare annotation, N22 - aus, IR64 - indica, and Azucena - trop japonica (13 rice genomes publication ...).
The scaffold / chromosome / gene sequence name spelling is important. This tool makes sure you get the correct sequence names in your genome of choice.
Linux tools grep, cut, and sed were used to extract contig names from the multi FASTA file.
